citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There was 1 guinea pig observed with a health condition requiring treatment in accordance with the Program of Veterinary
Care or consultation with the attending veterinarian. An adult tan and white guinea pig in Pen 112 was observed holding
the right rear leg up on and off. The right rear foot was mildly swollen with a 1 cm red area where the skin was broken
open. The licensee had not observed the health condition and was not treating the animal.
Swollen feet can be painful and if caused by an infection, can worsen and spread to other parts of the body and result in
other health issues.
The licensee must communicate with the attending veterinarian to evaluate this animal and determine an appropriate plan
for diagnosis and treatment.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
There was 1 guinea pig observed with a health condition requiring treatment in accordance with the Program of Veterinary 
Care or consultation with the attending veterinarian. An adult tan and white guinea pig in Pen 112 was observed holding 
the right rear leg up on and off. The right rear foot was mildly swollen with a 1 cm red area where the skin was broken 
open. The licensee had not observed the health condition and was not treating the animal. 
Swollen feet can be painful and if caused by an infection, can worsen and spread to other parts of the body and result in 
other health issues.  
The licensee must communicate with the attending veterinarian to evaluate this animal and determine an appropriate plan 
for diagnosis and treatment. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
